meanings.definition: To reverse or undo an event or action.
meanings.sent1: I wish I could unhappen the mistake I made.
meanings.sent2: She tried to unhappen the damage by apologizing.
meanings.sent3: If only we could unhappen spilled milk!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a magic spell, trying to unhappen the past.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's power was to unhappen any tragedy.

meanings.definition: To fail to occur or come to pass.
meanings.sent1: The predicted storm did not unhappen as expected.
meanings.sent2: His hopes for a promotion seemed to unhappen before his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The party's cancellation made it unhappen for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The dream of winning the lottery unhappened with each wrong number.
meanings.sent5: The magic trick was supposed to make the rabbit unhappen, but it didn't work.
